question_text: What is the role of the read/write head in a traditional hard drive?
answer_options: It spins the platters at high speed
It moves data to the cloud
It performs reading and writing of data on platters
It filters dust from entering the drive
correct_answer: It performs reading and writing of data on platters
explanation: The read/write head accesses magnetic data on the spinning platters by changing the polarity of magnetic domains.
